intro: Fimbristylis lanifera, commonly known as the soft-haired sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage with soft, hairy textures on its leaves and stems. This species typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as swamps and seasonally flooded areas. The plant produces small, clustered flower heads that are usually inconspicuous, typical of many sedges. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
